Communicate the state of the entire system
Banners are triggered because of system states rather than a user's action. They often
appear on page load and, if necessary, a message can persist across the application.
They're best for communicating things like seasonal promotions or considerations that
relate broadly to the entire application.

Place Banners appropriately
Banners are placed at the top of the primary parent container and span its entire width.
They are inline elements, meaning they add to the page height and push content down
when they appear and lift content higher when they are removed. Banners are typically
placed above site navigation.
